Training Coordinator
Location:
Rotterdam, NL
Country/Region: NL
Job Area: Project & Information Management
Business Unit: Neste Business Unit
Are you a creator of change?

Everything we do at Neste serves one purpose: to create a healthier planet for our children. Over the past ten years, Neste’s transformation journey has taken the company from a local oil refining company to becoming a global leader in renewable and circular solutions.
Our purpose pushes us forward to search for new ways to reduce the amount of carbon released into the atmosphere, and to innovate circular solutions to reuse carbon again and again. Are you going to help us combat climate change?
We are looking for a talented Training Coordinator to join our Rotterdam Capacity Growth Project owner’s Team. You will have the opportunity to join a Team of passionate professionals creating a healthier planet for our children.

This position is a temporary project assignment until the end of 2025.

Your part in the Rotterdam Capacity Growth Project journey

In this role, you will be part of a Competence Development Team whose main objective is to ensure that the organisation has the required critical knowledge and skills, in order to safely start up the expanded refinery and successfully continue the sustainable operations.

In your role, you will:

Plan and coordinate on- and off-site training activities for employees working in various roles in our Rotterdam refinery.
Develop and manage an integrated overall plan including various activities and learning paths over different disciplines.
Act as a key user of the learning management system, including the learning path creation, data handling, training record follow up etc.
Manage and maintain in-house training facilities, handle logistics for training activities including the venues and training equipment.
Develop training aids such as manuals, handbooks and content supporting successful learning outcomes.
Facilitate learning through a variety of delivery methods including classroom instruction, virtual training and on-the-job coaching.
Design and apply assessment tools to ensure training effectiveness.
Track and report on training outcomes.
You will work closely with the Project Owner’s Team members, site organisation and the learners to support their development and ensure that the learning paths are delivered effectively and on time. Our work combines accountability, cooperation, and the desire to develop and renew. Working safely at all times is essential to all of us.

We have an international team of experts supporting the organisation by developing learning and development structures and processes for the organisation.

 The best combination to success in this challenging role

Proven work experience as a Training Coordinator, Trainer, Training Facilitator or knowledge of adult learning theory and principles.
Excellent planning and organising skills and ability to manage several simultaneous activities.
Hands-on experience of planning and coordinating training activities in an international environment.
Service mindset, “Can do” attitude and passion for continuous development and learning.
Knowledge and experience about learning management systems.
Skills to facilitate learning through a variety of delivery methods including classroom workshops and online training.
We also value

Studies or degree in Education, Training, Project management or related field.
Fluency in Dutch and English.
Relevant experience with instruction and training.
Experience in a refinery environment.
Analytical thinking skills and ability to make conclusions based on data analysis.
Knowledge and skills about Google tools.
Please submit your application (in English) by March the end of March 2023.

If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please get in touch with
Tommi Leppänen, Competence Development Manager at tommi.leppanen@neste.com or
Djini Bhugwansing, Competence Development Manager at djini.bhugwansing@neste.com

The recruitment process includes interviews and possible aptitude testing. We will start interviewing suitable candidates already during the application period.

Join us in creating a healthier planet for our children.

Our success is based on our people who are the driving force behind Neste’s transformation to become a global leader in renewable and circular solutions. We are also committed to carbon neutral production by 2035. The passion that we have for creating a healthier planet for our children is what makes us unique.
We have set high standards for biodiversity, human rights and supply chain. We have consistently been included in the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices and the Global 100 list of the world’s most sustainable companies.

To carry out our strategy and business growth, our values guide our work. We support, develop and take care of the wellbeing of our people to enable them to grow, innovate and build our future.

We care. We have courage. We cooperate.

At Neste we want our people to feel good and do good. We provide clear and transparent targets, development opportunities, empowering leadership as well as rewards based on role and responsibilities.

Neste’s strategy is called ‘’Faster, Bolder and Together‘’. It reflects the understanding that there is no time to lose in combating climate change or helping to tackle the waste plastic challenge. In order to succeed, we need to act, innovate new solutions and deliver them faster and bolder than ever before – together.

In the end, it is the people who make the company. We are Neste.

job_description:
Local Unit & Position Description:

Do you want to make a difference in the Energy Transition of our clients?
We are looking for a motivated new colleague for our team in Arnhem, who will be actively involved in both the execution and managing of projects as well as our Business Development activities in that area. In this you will work closely together with the other members of our Energy, Markets and Technology team and colleagues abroad.
Are you our new colleague that likes this combination and has the right background, expertise and network that fits this profile?
We are offering a challenging and responsible job in a dynamic and international environment. You will be part of a team of 4.000 committed Energy professionals within DNV. Your home office will be in Arnhem, you will work closely together with our colleagues in other DNV teams and offices around the world.
We offer you appropriate opportunities for personal growth.
We are looking for a Senior Consultant / Project Manager Energy Transition Technology.
The purpose of this role as a Senior Consultant / Project Manager Energy Transition Technology is to support our customers to realize their goals and ambitions in the energy transition. You will work in our Energy Transition Technologies team focussing on technical and strategic advisory services to (inter)national utilities, industry, asset owners, governmental organizations and investors helping them to reach CO2 targets and energy transition goals.
The project portfolio of the team is a mix of technology and service development work for clients and groups of clients, demonstration and testing of existing and new innovative energy technologies, consultancy on these technologies, combined with market and regulatory modelling and consultancy services.
Our team works on a wide variety of energy and decarbonization technologies with application in the energy transition, such as: biomass and waste, sustainable fuels, hydrogen, electrification, hydro, geothermal and biogas.
Our service portfolio covers project management and project development services, feasibility and sourcing studies, bankers and lenders technical support, operational support, independent engineering services, system engineering and integration, technical benchmarks and technical due diligence and qualification.
The team is currently growing and to strengthen its position on the abovementioned services and sectors. We are looking for a senior consultant/project manager, who will be part of a customer-centric technical team and will actively be working on the acquisition, managing and execution of projects, sales and business development activities.
Position Qualifications:

Key Accountabilities:
To provide consultancy and project management services and advice to our customers.
act as a consultant and advise our clients in projects and combine that with the role of project manager
ensure that projects are executed within scope, quality, budget and planning
be the key expert and first point of contact for our customers on specific topics or services
write and review proposals reports and advice to our customers.
contribute to clear and high-quality customer interactions and presentations.
work together with and lead colleagues and experts in projects.
leverage with younger colleagues and develop the team.
sell new projects to grow our business.
build a network with (potential) clients.
identify customer/market opportunities and develop our services based on these needs.
Person specification:
Competency Requirements
Initiative & Responsibility: Acts on own initiative , makes things happen and takes responsibility. Is result driven
Constructive teamwork: Co-operates well with others; shares knowledge, experience, and information; supports others in the pursuit of team goals.
Effective communication: Communicates in a clear, precise, and structured way, verbally and in written. Knows how to convince and engage people.
Networking: Builds a useful internal and external network of contacts and relationships. Utilizes networks, contact, and relations to achieve objectives.
Self-development: Is aware of own strengths and limitations and pursues learning and career development opportunities.
People management Provides the team with a clear sense of direction, inspires, and co-ordinates others, and keeps them focused on objectives.
Technical / Professional Expertise and Qualifications Required:
Education:
Bachelor or Master’s degree in a technical study, preferable with a specialization in Energy and/or business management
Key skills required:
Several years of relevant working experience in the energy industry with experience in technical and/or financial consulting, project development and project management
Affinity with energy- and production processes in the industry
Strong network in Industry
Strong skills and capabilities to develop yourself as a consultant and project manager
Understanding of the technical consequences of a business decision as well as the business consequences of a technical decision.
Ability to work individually as well as in a team.
Ability to handle complex (technical) problems and be able to deal with multiple parties with conflicting interests.
Ability to lead (inter)national projects and function as a trusted partner of our customers.
Confident, able to get their view across and willing to participate in training/mentoring junior of staff, ideally had previous training skills
Effective writing and communication skills both in Dutch and English language are a requirement
Our offer
A career in DNV is not just a job. It is an extraordinary opportunity to develop and enrich your life and make more of a global impact than you ever believed possible. Discover more here: https://www.dnv.com/careers/why-dnvgl.html
BE CHALLENGED
We have an enviable client list – we work with the biggest names out there. Our position enables us to lead the development in many industries. Whether we work with renowned companies, innovative startups or joint industry projects, you will get a chance to utilize your expertise together with specialists from a wide range of disciplines. It will all broaden your view and deepen your skills.
LEARN AND GROW
Our knowledge-based and digitally focused organisation will help you learn and grow. Be assured that it is not just something we talk about. Every year we invest 5% of our revenue on research, innovation and development. We also invest strongly in competence development and progression for our people. From on the job learning to joining networks, receiving coaching and participating in training programs, we help to support you progress.
MAKE AN IMPACT
Joining us is an opportunity to make the world a better place. Employees in DNV feel strongly about the company’s Purpose to "safeguard life, property and the environment”. This is our reason for being since our foundation in 1864. Our Vision to be “a trusted voice to tackle global transformations”, gives our people direction and expresses what we would like to accomplish in the long term.
BE INSPIRED AND ENRICHED
You will be part of a culture that embrace the values of caring, daring and sharing. These are the three core values that shape our performance; We care for each other, our customers, our planet, and we take care of ourselves. We dare to explore, to experiment, to be different, and to be courageous, curious, and creative. We share our experience and knowledge. We collaborate with each other and our customers. We support social, sport and team building activities. As a result, we continue to thrive, grow and develop.
Our benefits package is specifically designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being:
Receive a competitive compensation package.
Get secured for the future with our pension scheme, profit share, health care benefits and wellness programs.
Enjoy the flexibility to handle your work in a way that suits you and your lifestyle and achieve a good work/life balance.
Great atmosphere of working together with professionals and some of the most engaged and knowledgeable people in the industry.
Receive guidance from colleagues through coaching, mentoring and participating in international networks.
Advance your professional skills and technical expertise, through individual competence development plans and tailored training.
Develop your managerial skills, by going through our state-of-the-art leadership programs.
Be part of a world growing and renowned organization with origins dating back to 1864.
Company & Business Area Description:

DNV is the independent expert in energy, assurance and risk management, operating with 12.000 employees in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions. With 4.000 Energy experts we take a leading role in the energy transition of our costumers.
We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity!

Project Manager
Location:
Rotterdam, NL
Country/Region: NL
Job Area: Project & Information Management
Business Unit: Neste Business Unit
Are you a creator of change?

Everything we do at Neste serves one purpose: to create a healthier planet for our children. Over the past ten years, Neste’s transformation journey has taken the company from a local oil refining company to becoming a global leader in renewable and circular solutions.
Our purpose pushes us forward to search for new ways to reduce the amount of carbon released into the atmosphere, and to innovate circular solutions to reuse carbon again and again. Are you going to help us combat climate change?
Neste Netherlands is part of the Finnish parent company Neste. The plant in Rotterdam produces renewable fuels. Together with 200 colleagues we are working everyday to operate, maintain, and improve the plant in an efficient and safe manner.

We are looking for a Project Manager to join our Engineering Solutions team in Rotterdam.
As a Project Manager you will manage a project portfolio to support different projects according to Neste operating model safely in compliance with agreed project scope, schedule, cost and quality.

Your main responsibilities in creating a sustainable future are:
Support the effort to identify, evaluate, and select project alternatives by providing relevant project development and execution expertise.
Provides the expertise and resources to identify the project risks.
Develop the milestone schedule and requirements for turnaround integration.
Prepare the cost estimate.
Develop detailed plans for Feasibility/Definition and high-level plans for execution including construction.
Lead the engineering team.

During definition and execution phases the Project Manager shall be accountable for overall delivery of assigned projects including, but not limited to, the following:
Manage the projects according to Neste operating model safely in compliance with agreed project scope, schedule, cost and quality.
Ensuring resourcing and leading the projects internal engineering, procurement and construction team.
Track project's scope, schedule and costs for changes. Prepare change requests for any deviation and lead the approval process.
Maintain a strategic focus for the project with frequent interaction with the Development Manager, Project Owner and Line Manager.
Ensuring project team members' understanding and commitment to project scope, schedule and cost as well as driving for project team members' ownership of their own scope.
Driving for project management best practices and efficient communication in order to create seamless and goal oriented teamwork in projects.
Sharing project management best practices within the organization
Ensure efficient communication and information sharing between engineering disciplines and other project stakeholders.
Develop and implement mitigation plans for off-schedule/budget/deliverables, unanticipated occurrences and risks.
Develop and implement mitigation plans for deviances in schedule/ budget/ deliverables as well as unanticipated occurrences and risks when required.
Ensure that project execution shall fulfill requirements of law and authorities and that all required permits (e.g. building permit) have been granted. Maintain awareness of safety and environmental requirements.
Reporting projects' status according to agreed principles.
Maintain project's data promptly up to date in Neste’s ERP-system.
Ensure and assist preparation of internal invoices and approve them for invoicing.
Hand over the completed project to Owner as agreed.

You will report to the Project Management Office Leader of the Netherlands, but you are expected to work very independently, collaborating closely and networking easily with the project organization in other Neste locations as well.

The best combination to success in this role:
M.Sc. or B.Sc. in engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Project Management studies and certification such as PMI's Project Management Professional (PMP).
Minimum 5 years industrial related project management experience in an EPCM environment, with experience in all the different project phases but specifically in the definition and execution phases.
Leadership and human resources management skills.
Project scheduling skills by utilizing Project Management Software such as MS Project or Primavera. Basic Microsoft Office skills and/or Google tools.
Possesses a general understanding of contract administration, business principles and business law.
Effective communication skills in English (mandatory) both verbally and in writing. Preferably command of the Dutch language. Other language skills are an advantage.
Experience in Renewable Processes is an advantage.
Living in the Netherlands

We also value:
A team player.
A driven person with ambition for personal development.
Effective analytical and problem-solving skills.
Leadership through example.

Please submit your application by the end of March.

The Role
What’s the role?
The Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rotterdam is a great place to work with many learning and development opportunities for employees who are looking for deepening and broadening their professional- as well as their leadership skills in a complex and diverse organization.
We expect our site to undergo a radical transformation in the decades ahead as we facilitate the energy transition and work towards net zero CO2 emission. Shell energy & chemical Park Rotterdam has developed a strategy and plans for a drastic reduction of emissions and the first world scale projects are already being built.
In order to thrive and accelerate this transition we are looking for enthusiastic and capable professionals who are looking to make their mark. We are paying for these projects with the profits of today, which make it imperative that our existing refinery operates safely, reliably, and efficiently. The scale of our ambition means that the technology department is looking for Process Engineers and Process Technologists at all levels.
A career in Technology and Process Engineering at the Shell Energy & Chemical Park Rotterdam places you at the centre of where the energy transition is taking place and is guaranteed to be both challenging and rewarding, providing ample opportunities for professional growth as you build your career.
Process Engineers (and Process Technologists) work closely with operations, inspection, economics & scheduling, Engineering disciplines & Contractors, and the project organization. They perform key roles in providing support for the production units through daily optimization & troubleshootingor giving assurance on the Management of Change process, process safety evaluations or developing and implementing projects. From billion dollar projects to set point adjustments of cut points our Process Engineers and Technologists provide a guiding hand to a vast array of activities taking place on and off site. Investments in all categories are being developed by process engineering professionals to improve the safety, environmental performance, reliability, and profitability of the Shell energy & Chemicals Park Rotterdam.
The Technology department comprises approximately 80 Shell staff across several different teams, the majority of which have a process engineering background. The teams are separated into 3 Process Technology teams supporting day to day operations of the Refining and chemical units, 3 Process Engineering teams supporting longer term project development and change assurance for the same units. A dedicated process safety team, a Utilities, Energy & CO2 team and a Business Opportunity Team. Many of our process engineers move on within the site to roles in operations or economics departments or further within Shell after rotating through a number of Technology/Process engineering functions.
The process engineering roles broadly consists of the following three categories:
Process Engineering Assurance
Participate in process safety studies (HAZID, HAZOP, LOPA, etc.) in design phase of projects or periodic reviews during operate phase, Lead process safety studies for plant modifications, test runs and (complex) work instructions
Participate in (or lead) PSSR (Pre Start-up Safety Reviews) for new projects or Turnarounds
Project Development
Conducting scouting and feasibility studies on proposals from Operations or Technology.
Project development in liaison with engineering contractors and ensuring end-result is supported by asset owner
Provide support to construction and startup.
Ensure proper implementation and performance when integrated into existing operating units.
Short & Long Term Unit support
Daily optimization of operating parameters together with colleagues in operations and the wider asset team
Contributing to process integrity of installations via proactive technical monitoring to ensure the safe, environmentally sound, reliable, and profitable operation of the units.
Developing strategies and tactics for the mitigation of threats
Provide support for preparation and execution of unit turnarounds. Provide ad-hoc support for unit trouble shooting and participate in turnaround work supporting a larger team.
What we need from you
Prior manufacturing experience is a benefit along with process engineering experience and experience with the development of projects. You are expected to:
Master ChE degree (or equivalent).
Proven track record in refining/chemical/utility plant process engineering on an operating site and/or design office.
Good knowledge of refining, chemical and/or utility processes in general
Critical thinking to use your external perspective to help us identify ways to improve how we work
Strong communication skills are essential.
Ability to cooperate with external parties (clients, Engineering contractors, etc.).
Demonstrate a commitment to the Core Values: Value and Respect all People/Integrity/Customer Focus/Act for the Greater Whole.
Manage a diverse work list with varying length of timelines, varying levels of urgency, interrelationships, and varying stakeholders.
Develop/guide lesser experienced team members in their development program.
Be proactive, working closely with Operations, Maintenance, Inspection, and the other SNR Engineering disciplines as well as the Engineering Contractor counterpart to ensure thorough and complete communication of process issues at hand.
Facilitate problem resolution when the problem requires Process Engineering knowledge and expertise.
Ensure Process Engineering activities are conducted fully in line with Shell Group and governmental regulations.
Company Description
Shell Nederland BV is a platform for international collaboration, with Shell offering direct employment to around ten thousand people in the Netherlands alone, including roughly 2,800 non-Dutch employees from around 80 countries. Diversity is key at Shell Nederland, and our employees reflect the innovation that stems from a diverse workforce. By joining Shell Nederland, you will benefit from an unrivalled industry-leading development programme that will see you tap into a pool of expert knowledge that will help propel your career. Shell Nederland is the holding company of most Shell companies operating in the Netherlands. Shell Nederland also has an advisory and coordinating role in numerous areas.
An innovative place to work
There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.
Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.
An inclusive place to work
To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.
We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.
We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
A rewarding place to work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.
We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell/Shell Group companies around the world. Senior Reliability Engineer
Location:
Rotterdam, NL
Country/Region: NL
Job Area: Production
Business Unit: RP Production
Are you a creator of change?

Our purpose pushes us forward to search for new ways to reduce the amount of carbon released into the atmosphere, and to innovate circular solutions to reuse carbon again and again. Are you going to help us combat climate change?
We are looking for a Reliability & Process Integrity Engineer to join the global Reliability & Process Integrity team based in Rotterdam Maasvlakte.
Your part in Neste journey
In the Renewables Production Platform (RPP), the global Reliability & Process Integrity team supports our strategic business objectives by creating a safe & sustainable reliability and process safety culture; the team is responsible for developing a multi-year reliability strategy and driving a cross-functional cross-layer collaboration to implement the strategy.
In your role as Reliability & Process Integrity Engineer, you will be responsible for developing the site reliability & process integrity priorities in line with our global strategy. Act as the site subject matter expert for risk based work selection and facilitate equipment criticality assessments.

Other main responsibilities are:

Create and continuously promote a strong reliability & process safety culture at site.
Create and implement fit for purpose work processes that guide the organisation to apply the key reliability principles when designing, operating and maintaining the equipment. Ensure that the key reliability processes are well reflected in our NMS system.
Drive continuous improvement of asset availability and minimise equipment life cycle cost. Effectively collaborate cross-functionally and cross-layers to implement the objectives in the site strategy.
Foster a learning environment at site and promote strong cross-site collaboration with the other RPP sites.
Promote the use of reliability fundamental principles, tools and methodologies.
Act as a facilitator for RCA - root cause analysis, FMEA - Failure Mode Effect Analysis, RCM - Reliability Centred Maintenance, Benefit-to Cost analysis, LCCA - Life Cycle Cost analysis, among other reliability methodologies.
Collaborate with process safety eng’s and operations eng’s in risk assessments (both HSE & financial). Conduct vulnerability studies as needed. Manage discovered work / risks.
Facilitate development of Equipment Strategies (ES) and coordinate the start of site ES program.
Develop and implement a spare parts philosophy in line with the business objectives and the outcome of Equipment Strategies
Support operations integrity programs and development of operating envelopes for the site.
Ensure a well defined and documented process is in place and being consistently used at the site for the above reliability processes. Action items are tracked & effectiveness of recommendations are monitored. Recommendations are assessed and continuous improvement made.
Start development of an annual maintenance plan (condition based, time based PMs, improvements) and support risk based justification of Turnaround work-scope.
Ensure a healthy set of reliability KPIs exists at different levels and functions in the organisation (both lagging and leading indicators). Ensure effective monitoring so that it helps to identify key improvement opportunities (for the site or globally) in the way we design, operate and maintain equipment.
Coordinate the site equipment bad actor program. Support equipment/maintenance engineers for effective equipment health processes (e.g. equipment health monitoring, KPIs, bad actor resolution, obsolescence program)
Subject matter expert for reliability incident investigations
Act as an interface with projects to ensure project reliability deliverables are met; support development of preventive maintenance strategies for new assets.

In this global role, you will work closely with the Head of Reliability & Process Integrity and will have multiple interfaces with departments like Maintenance, Engineering, Technical and Operations.
Our work combines accountability, cooperation, and the desire to develop and renew. Working safely at all times is essential to all of us.

Keys to success in this role

The best combination of experiences, skills and background is:
Master's degree in engineering.
Minimum 8 years experience in the Oil & Gas or Chemical industry with 5+ years in operational roles.
Applied knowledge of reliability fundamental principles, methodologies and tools.
Experience in Risk Management applied to process integrity and asset management.

We also value:
Analytical & problem solving skills
Initiative & proactiveness
Leadership capabilities
Ability to stretch from tactical to strategic

Senior Project Developer - Storage
Full-time
Company Description
Why Statkraft:
Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.
But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.
Job Description
We are currently looking for an experienced and enthusiastic (Senior) Project Developer - Storage to join our team in Statkraft Netherlands! Our offices in Netherlands are in Amsterdam and s-Hertogenbosch. We work on a “hybrid work” mode (home/office based) with regular travel within Netherlands and occasionally abroad for this position.
You will be part of the Storage team currently focused on developing battery storage. This encompasses both stand-alone utility scale battery storage as well as batteries co-located with our ground mounted solar PV projects and onshore wind projects in The Netherlands.
Your role:
Analysing the market for storage and contributing to the strategy for storage in the Netherlands
Identification of stand-alone utility scale battery storage projects, contributing to the development pipeline
Project development from site identification to permit
Manage the grid access through relationship with the various network operators
Coordinating site specifics with financial and technical colleagues and determine the consequences
Liaising with spatial planners and other advisers to prepare permit applications
Initiating and managing the permit application process towards province and municipality
Stakeholder management and community engagement
Pro-active contribution to the development of provincial and municipal vision and/or spatial planning
Track project level progress and risks. Provide insightful analysis and reporting to management

Stepping up in the cable industry? Join DNV for a dynamic and international career on the top of the cable world!
DNV is one of the world’s leading advisory and verification consultancy firms in Power Cables and is looking for an experienced consultant in the area of Underground and Submarine Power Cables to strengthen our team at our Energy Systems office location in Arnhem, the Netherlands.
Due to the rapid acceleration and transition to greener and more renewable energy resources worldwide. DNV has seen and experienced an exponential growth to act and be a strategic partner and trusted voice to the industry to tackle this very important energy transition, while also continuing to keep a watchful eye on the management of existing electrical plants and infrastructure. This includes therefore also advisory and verification services DNV perform for Power Cables, which has become a critical and key system component to connect both offshore and onshore for wind farms, solar plants, hydro plants, transmission operators and distribution operators, where our role include the performance of concept design studies, basic system designs, specifications, tender evaluations, design reviews, failure analysis, and inspections and quality assurance during design, manufacturing, installation and commissioning.
As a Senior Consultant Power Cables in Underground and Submarine Power Cables you will be part of the Power Cables Team, and together with other colleagues you will help our customers achieve sustainable, world-class cable systems.
The projects you execute are for any electrical asset owner, project developer, manufacturer, insurer or other party dealing with high voltage AC or DC power cable systems. Our team in Arnhem, holds a leading position outside and within DNV worldwide, by expertise and experience. Therefore, work is of an international nature, and often in cooperation with other DNV offices (e.g. Korea, Canada, Dubai, Singapore, China, etc.).
You will provide engineering and consultancy services to customers in the utility and manufacturing industry worldwide. You will be responsible for the management and execution of projects in the field of power cables. You understand the market we operate in and can deliver high-quality content.

The Role
Where you fit in
As one of the world’s leading energy companies, Shell plays a key role in meeting the world’s growing energy demand in economically, environmentally and socially responsible ways. There has never been a more exciting time to be part of the energy industry. Join us in our ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, and sooner if that is possible.
Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk is one of Europe’s leading Chemicals manufacturing locations where using complex processes, base chemicals are produced. Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk will accelerate the energy transition, be a leader in the sustainable transformation of the chemical industry and grow by making more circular, low-CO2, future-proof products for our customers and society.
Insulation materials, lightweight plastics, blades for windmills, detergents, mattrasses, batteries, sport shoes. Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk will become increasingly sustainable when making the chemical building blocks for these type of key products for society.
Thanks to the existing and planned new activities, the number of plants at Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk may double in the coming decade, while simultaneously we, on balance, aim to no longer emit CO2. In accomplishing this, Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk joins forces with other companies, customers, employees, organizations, governments, and network operators. Only together as a society we can successfully carry out the transitions in the speed that is required. Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk wants to make a strong effort to help society become more sustainable on a large scale and as quickly as possible.
The transformation of Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk offers not only benefits for society but also provides opportunities for employees. There will continue to be new and exciting jobs. The changes are accompanied by innovations and improvements in, for example, the IT field, Digitalization and development towards new knowledge and activities. This gives employees the opportunity to personally contribute to making society more sustainable.
Together we build the industry of the future!
The Instrument Project Engineer is accountable for the integrity, reliability and operability of all instrumentation and control designs in the projects, plant changes and turnarounds within their assigned area of the plant.
As an Instrument Project Engineer at Shell Chemicals Park Moerdijk in Klundert, you are the counterpart to the engineering contractors during the projects for instrumentation and process control and you contribute to the development of cost-efficient solutions to the asset and project department. All services shall comply with governmental, group and chemical standards and regulations.
You will lead engineering activities covering key areas of Process Automation including technology selection, automation systems, instrumented safeguarding, alarm management, process analyzers, flow metering, level, temperature, pressure measurement and process control.
What’s the role?
The Instrument project engineer will be part of the Instrument Engineering team, which is being expanded due to the large project workload.
The Instrument Project Engineer will support the large energy transition and circular economy projects on site Moerdijk.
You will be required to deliver the right instrumentation scope for the projects, plant changes and turnarounds you are working on. One of the success factors is the timely delivery of the right instrumentation scope to guarantee a flawless operation and efficient maintenance after implementation of the project or plant change.
The scope for the projects and plant changes and turnarounds will be delivered by many different parties and studies (SIS, RCM, LOPA, HAZOP, etc.) and you are responsible for collecting all the scope and give technical judgement to produce clear scope descriptions which will lead to the most cost-effective implementation of the projects.
During the projects and turnaround work preparation process you will clarify the scope and review the work packages. Author the project and plant changes within the instrumentation and process control discipline and contribute to reviews and approve instrumentation and process control content of plant changes by other disciplines. During the execution phase you will provide assurance that the scope will be implemented as required.
The Instrument Project Engineer is also accountable for complete as built in all databases and document control systems. (SIFpro, GSAP, AIM, SPI, etc).
Managing skills combined with a broad understanding of discipline engineering in an operating environment and be capable of developing new systems and structures by thinking out of the box.
Will lead by example, motivate, coach and provide active guidance to colleague engineers from within the section, contractor office personnel and/or contractor staff. Encourage first enterprise behaviors in/across multiple teams and recognize & reward staff who excel in their personal performance.
What we need from you?
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in engineering (preferred in Electrical Engineering, Control & Automation, Industrial Technology or Computer Science).
Experience in Instrument Project Engineering, preferably gained in a refinery or chemicals site.
Adequate knowledge of relevant instrument design engineering practices and standards is essential.
Knowledge of refining and/or chemical processes & process technology is beneficial.
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills to work effectively in/and across multi-functional teams and interface with a wide range of internal stakeholders, customers and service providers.
Display courage and professionalism. in people management, and lead, develop and foster an open culture within team to drive for success.
Strong background in instrumentation, analyzers, custody meter and control discipline for industrial/petro-chemical applications.
Good knowledge of safe work practices and engineering obligations in an industrial environment including change management (MOC) work processes and procedures.
Professional working proficiency in Dutch language is required (or willing to learn within a year), combined with English language skills both spoken and written
Effective stakeholder management is essential to identify and understand (business) requirements and translate these into delivering innovative and sustainable value solutions.
Be a self-starter with a healthy learner mindset, hands-on approach and can-do mentality, have the analytical capability to identify and solve project related instrument related problems.
